intro: Thelasis contracta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant has linear, often hairy leaves that are adapted to thrive in rocky or dry environments. Thelasis contracta is typically found in alpine or arctic regions, where it grows in open, sunny habitats. Its compact growth habit and ability to withstand harsh conditions make it a resilient species in its native range.
